meanings.definition: The process of learning to behave in a way that is acceptable to society.
meanings.sent1: Socialization is important for children to learn how to interact with others.
meanings.sent2: My daughter's socialization at school has helped her make new friends.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's socialization with other dogs at the park was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her socialization into the world of ballet was like stepping into a new realm.
meanings.sent5: The socialization of the new employee into the company culture was seamless.

meanings.definition: The act of mixing socially with others.
meanings.sent1: Socialization at the party was enjoyable as I met new people.
meanings.sent2: His lack of socialization made it difficult for him to make friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat's socialization with the neighborhood cats was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The socialization of flavors in the dish created a unique taste.
meanings.sent5: The socialization of ideas in the meeting led to a productive discussion.

meanings.definition: The process of adapting or adjusting to the norms of a culture or society.
meanings.sent1: Her socialization into the new school's rules took some time.
meanings.sent2: The socialization of immigrants into a new country can be challenging.
meanings.sent3: The robot's socialization with human customs was comical to observe.
meanings.sent4: The socialization of technology into everyday life has been rapid.
meanings.sent5: The socialization of traditions across generations keeps cultures alive.
